page.title: 02LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Winterbourne is typical of many rural villages presently undergoing a change in population structure but classed as a "dying village" in the 1950's because of its high percentages of pensioners who lived in old houses with big gardens.Since the 1960's and the opening of the Motorway young couples both earning good salaries in Newbury,Reading and Swindon have afforded the inflated house prices, necessary repairs and received planning permission for single houses in the large gardens compatible with the thatched cottages so the village retains its compact linear structure. Children attend primary schools in Boxford or Chieveley;the 19 century school is a pottery; other amenities are buses,telephones,pub and a post box.Having cars the population shops and seeks recreation elsewhere.
